oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-02-09 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from February 9, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Marty Robbins (host/performer), guest performer Jean Shepard, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Marty Robbins; Rod Brasfield; Jean Shepard; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Marty Robbins -- Singing The Blues (Marty Robbins) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Marty Robbins) -- Marty Robbins introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Marty Robbins) -- Marty Robbins introduces Jean Shepard -- If You Can Walk Away (Jean Shepard) -- Prince Albert commercial (Rod Brasfield, Marty Robbins) -- Marty Robbins talks -- Katy Hill -- Marty Robbins talks -- Blessed Jesus, Should I Fall Don't Let Me Lay (Marty Robbins) -- Marty Robbins introduces Chet Atkins -- Twelfth Street Rag (Chet Atkins) -- Marty Robbins introduces Minnie Pearl
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Robbins, Marty; Shepard, Jean, 1933-
